close_symbols: all functions called (directly or transitively) by toxdigitvalue
explanation:
1) toxdigitvalue — MHD_strx_to_uint64_ calls toxdigitvalue; to determine whether the target function (directly or indirectly) uses memcmp to compare null‑terminated strings you must inspect the full implementation of toxdigitvalue.  
2) memcmp — the MISRA rule is about use of the Standard Library function memcmp when comparing null‑terminated strings; the analyzer must know whether memcmp is invoked (and how) anywhere in the call chain.  
3) all functions called (directly or transitively) by toxdigitvalue — if toxdigitvalue itself calls other routines, those routines must be inspected as well because memcmp might occur deeper in the call chain; include their implementations so the analyzer can determine whether any memcmp usage compares null‑terminated strings.
